course_title: Special Topics in Latin American and Caribbean Studies: AfroCuban Music and Literature

class_notes:
(This course is taught in English)
(This course does NOT carry a GER tag)
This course will explore the significant aesthetical connections present in Afro-Cuban Literature and Music. We will examine the birth and the intersections of influential Afro Cuban aesthetics that have shaped culture and society in Cuba, emerging in literary texts and musical compositions, but also in philosophical essays analyzing Cuban literature and music. We will examine how throughout time Afro Cuban aesthetics have significantly influenced postcolonial cultural expressions / artistic representations in the island. Our analytic endeavor should focus on the developments of Afro Cuban culture and its instrumental effects into shaping Cuban culture.
We will attempt to answer questions such as: How Afro-Cuban Aesthetics are present in Cuban culture? Have Afro-Cuban Aesthetics expressed a socio-politics of racial inclusion and multiculturalism in the island? To what extent Cuban Aesthetics are Afro Cuban? What is Afro Cuban Aesthetics?
PARTICULARS: The evaluation of the seminar is based in attendance / participation (a two (2) students' presentation), a short essay (3 pages) due by the four week of classes, one midterm essay (5 pages) and one comparative final paper (10 pages).
